Posts.Content: Dec 22, 2008 06:18AM CurlyKatFL wrote: FlaLady no worries on the personal questions. Thank goodnees it is not bowel movment related, I have been as regular as ever. I will keep that in mind though. Sandy I figure when I get to ther doctors office after the holiday it will be about 2 weeks. I have noticed that heat and streching does provide some releif. But sleeping is still an issue without some kind of pain med. Thanks for all the input ladies Kathy
Posts.Title: When to ask for a scan and which doc to call ??? CurlyKatFL CurlyKatFL

Posts.Content: CurlyKatFL wrote: Hi Ladies, I have not posted here in many months,but I have a question that you guys are most suited to answer. I have had some pain in my hip (actually is feels like my butt) for a few days. It is intermittent but sometimes it is painful to walk and last night the pain actually woke me up. Motrin does take the edge off. I don't remember doing anything that would have caused an injury or strain. So of course in the back of my mind I am thinking could it be mets to the bones. I don't want to seem like a paranoid whiner but of course I am worried. SO do I wait a little while and see if I just hurt my hip somehow and that it will heal? Do I call the doctor and ask for a scan? And which doctor do I call my primary care or my onc? Thanks Kathy PS I missed you guys :) Dx 4/23/2004, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 3, 1/13 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: When to ask for a scan and which doc to call ??? CurlyKatFL CurlyKatFL

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2007 04:07PM CurlyKatFL wrote: Ruth I am so sorry this is happening to you. I agree with FitChik about changing your screen name. About 3 years ago when I was going through treatment a very gossipy person from my office tracked me here and proceeded to tell everyone in the office who would listen about all my medical problems during treatment. I remember how completely violated I felt. I changed my screen name and that stopped it. Some people just seem to need to hurt other people. I just don't get it. Don't let her chase you away. You deserve to feel comfortable and share with us Hugs Kat

Posts.Content: Dec 14, 2007 02:26PM - edited Dec 14, 2007 02:28PM by CurlyKatFL Bimmer I just showed your post to my mother. My mother has lost a daughter and a sister to this terrible disease and is now battling the beast with her baby (that would be me). She wants me to tell you she is "mad as hell" and she feels your pain. The beast has taken its toll on our family as it is doing to yours. We as a country throw so much money at research where is the progress? Bimmer you and Diane are in our thoughts and prayers. Peace be the journey Kat Tender ... what a great idea, I'm in.

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2007 08:32PM - edited Dec 18, 2007 08:57PM by CurlyKatFL Bimmer, I am so sorry. There will come a day when your tears of sorrow will softly flow into tears of remembrance... and your heart will begin to heal itself... and grieving will be interrupted by episodes of joy... and you will hear the whisper of hope. There will come a day when you will welcome the tears of remembrance... as a sunshower of the soul... a turning of the tide... a promise of peace. Kat
